posts.author: MentalDekay
posts.content:
I've been considering playing an Arcance Archer build, but I hesitate because I once got annoyed when a ranged attack based uber-Cleric build was surrounded by baddies and was stuck using a sling (and no WF for a dagger or such). The AoOs were devastating(ly irritating).

I suppose run and gun is the tactic that these characters should employ, but what about those times that you can't? Or you took PBS and want to take it for a spin?

In terms of feats, is Mobility the most straightforward solution? Or is the answer to just pump dexterity and AC (as much as feasible)?

posts.author: MentalDekay
posts.content:
So this guy can still shoot from up close and just absorb the damage from the EDR, or switch to scimitar and make them confetti. I would not want to meet him in a duel. Or a knife fight.

But what about non-this guys? What are some other mitigations?

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
There isn't, other than a HiPSer (which is really, REALLY good unless your foes have vanilla True Seeing).

Of course, you could have some Monk levels (like, at least 3 here) so that you have Monk speed.  Then kiting becomes a pretty good option.  However, it does sort of mess a bit with the class structure (as you are Monk/Wiz/AA or Monk/Sorc/AA, because one cannot be Monk and Bard without alignment changes).

Still, Monk/Bard/AA sounds fascinating - http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 15728.html

If you are not against alignment changes, that is.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
About the most flawless toon I am aware of is Deadly Nightshade - deadly-nightshade-t2355576.html

This one comes the closest so far imo.

It is loaded with immunites, and can still hit stuff.  Quick as lightning, stealthy, incredibly hard to hit and damage, is almost immune to magic, and has just about everything anyone would ever want in one character (exception being Dev Crit, of course).

It's one character that can just show up anywhere and feel safe.  On WoG, I can go anywhere without having to "suit up" with gear, buffs, etc - she is good to go.
